title: Have you ever wake up by music in your head? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, every day possibly— no, everyday. I am a k-pop fan, a K-army so yes. BTS and theirs songs are so inspiring that it's very impossible not to wake with music in your head. Not only BTS, but Daya's songs are best for Teenage girls. I am a soon-to-be adult teenager (17) and I assume “Sit still, Look pretty" by her is a song every girl should listen. See you later by Blackpink (k-pop) is a sassy song for women. Music helps to calm you down. When you wake up, you get away from a sweet world, or a horrendous nightmare. But when, all of a sudden, a music of your choice starts playing in your mind, you feel at peace. Am I right? So, guys, waking up with music is normal for people. And that's also a gold feeling. I hope this article works for you. -Son Hwa-min.

Yes indeed, I have, THREE times!!! First time when it happened was 3 years ago. I usually listen music when I go to sleep at night. So, one morning I woke up listening a song in my head. That was english song and it was clear as my own language. I mean english is not my language but hell, the lyrics and tunes were sooo clear. I thought how did I memorized this song and singing it so perfectly. I was really proud actually of my sudden skill. But when I openend my eyes and got my head up from pillow, the song was slowly vanishing it. Then I looked under my pillow the saw that I forgot to pause music player, earphone was under my pillow and as result, that happened. Other times, the same thing happened actually…

Yes in fact I have quite a few times. Some songs in my head were positive songs, and some were negitive songs. It just all depends on what kind of dream you have and how well you sleep, and whay songs you listen to right before you go directly to sleep, it also depends on what kind of mood you're in as well before you go to sleep for the night or even take a cat nap even. I hope my answer was helpful to you.

All the time, the more you listen to a song the more likely it will get caught in your head. For example I play in a band and sometimes have to listen to our own music 20–30 times in a week, obviously it ends up sometimes waking me up at night just thinking about it especially if we are learning a cover. The most recent one that did this was:

Yes absolutely, actually that is really normal for a hardcore Metal fan like me!! It’s because of the touchy lyrics what goes the reality of my life. Most credit goes to the meaningful lyrics of an artist. what touches my heart and speak through my minds. Even being an Heavy Metal blogger i even consider myself as a headbanger or a hardcore Heavy Metal music fans. A question can be arise how can be the lyrics are so important in anyone’s life?! Here’s the link of my Heavy Metal Research paper even the psychoanalysis of a Metal Music fan. I’m sure that will answer all your questions. http://Metal Freaks: https://metalbandz.com/heavy-metal-bands/#Lyrical_Beauty_Lifestyle

Yes, back in early 90’s and 2 more. I woke up with a melody ringing in my head, and later I found out it was Klaus Doldinger, the theme of the child Empress from the neverending story.In mid 2000 I again woke up after having a dream and reading a score. I remember all those melody and quickly wrote it inro the music sheet.The last was almost the same only it was a composition from other composer.

Yes. But not in a good way…it was an OCD that was driving me crazy. I had just watched the movie, Mamma Mia and the song that got stuck in my head was “Our last Summer”. Usually when you have a song stuck in your head it can lasts for hours up to a day, but it was playing so much in my head that it literally started to play in my head for days (and nights). It started to stress me out and panic. It would play in my dreams at night, Id wake up from the dream, and it replayed in my head over and over again. I was exhausted…it was a nightmare. I guess you could call it OCD…but it never really happened again…it was a weird trigger I guess.

Infuriatingly, yes!! I belong to two choirs and often, after a rehearsal, I will wake in the middle of the night with one of the pieces going round and round in my head, a real ear worm. Sometimes the piece is difficult to sing, especially without accompaniment, which makes it doubly annoying. After a concert, this usually happens once or twice and then I’m fine again - till next time. I’m told the best way to lose an ear worm is to sing Happy Birthday to yourself though I confess I’ve never really tried it out!

I’ve had it happen multiple times, either I did hear it in the dreams or I just woke up and it was there, I usually find out cause I start singing it whilst going about my day. Might be cause my mind is getting off of another song that’s stuck in my head by getting a different one stuck in there, but it could also be cause I’m attached to it with out knowing and it sprung to life from a dream that inspired it.

Actually yes, it seems to be usually every weekend. I would constantly wake up to music in my head. Typically for me, it's songs I have heard before or just forgot months ago about. Yet, I consider this nothing to worry about! For me, it happens on “Weekend” day's.(However, for some it may be different.)

YEP….AND I NEVER COULD FALL SLEEP WITHOUT MUSIC PLAYING…AND SOON AS MY MUM OR DAD WOULD COME IN ROOM AND SWITCH IT OFF DUE TO FELL ASLEEP….I WOULD WAKE UP OPEN MY EYES AS IF I NOT EVEN BEEN SLEEP…I COULD OF BEEN SLEEP FOR MORE THAN 5 HOURS BUT SOON AS MUSIC GOT TURNED OFF I WOULD WAKE UP STRAIGHT AWAY….ITS MAD REALLY AND NOW IM 29 AND AND CANNOT SLEEP IF MUSIC,TV OR LIGHTS ON…

As a composer, it’s normal. Most musicians also experience it at one time or another. Music lovers have also been known to hear music upon waking. It’s not a sign of being abnormal, it’s a gift to be embraced. Perhaps, take up the craft, art, and business of music. Could be a calling card - this hearing music upon waking.

I’m not woken up by it, but most days when I wake up I do have a song in my head. I listen to music for large portions of my day, so this is hardly surprising. I usually stop and think about what song is in my head on a given morning to help me pick what music to put on as I get ready for my day. But no, I have never been woken up out of a sound sleep by music in my head.

I’ve never woken up BECAUSE music is running through my head. But, nearly every morning, I do wake up WITH music playing through my head. I love music, but I usually only listen to it when I’m in the car. Despite that, and with few exceptions, there’s a song or melody running through my mind from the time I wake up until I fall asleep.
yes I’ve woken up with music and voices playing in my head many times and there were even many times where I would sleep and not wake up I could not feel my body at all btw I take zero drugs

All the time, its become very eerie for me to not wake up with some song in my head. Sometimes its as simple and tourmenting as “the wheels on the bus" or the ONE verse I know of some random pop song. But mostly it lets me know what kind of emotional state my minds in from dreams and previous days.

Yes. Almost every morning. Then, the tune stays with me most of the day. Not continuously though. Just the other day, woke up with the song In da Gadda la vida by Iron Butterfly. (I love 60s and 70s rock, classic as well as heavy metal).

What a great question! I very often wake up to music in my head and, often I see people and music that I think fits that person: because of the way they walk or talk etc., makes me hear and see them musically. This week I have fallen in love again with Beethoven’s ‘The Tempest’ and it’s in my head constantly and I don’t mind at all. Thank you for the question, I’m sure I’m not alone.

All the time , I use this music to fall asleep to and when I wake up I find myself with Ambient type sounds in my mind. It is very pleasant to be honest. Here is a link where you can get the music at - Sleep
Yes, sometimes when I awake from my sleep, suddenly a random song appear out of nowhere. And it turns into an earworm for me and can’t stop “singing” that song all day long
Frequently and then have actually woken up with that song playing later that day if I happened to doze off again. Most morning dreams hold future answers.

Yes Sometimes when you sleep while music is on and just when you wake up, during that if the same songs is being played , then it feels like you were in dream for while of the night and you feel like it's in your head, not being played physically.
yes!!! every morning and before i sleep descendents enjoi album splir with jawbreaker until morning… its no waste on the two bands…
Whenever I don’t get much sleep I will wake up and have a melody in my head. Today was 1 of those days actually.

Yes.If we practice to wake up morning with a music,we feel good and the full day we will be fresh and active,It will be good to wake up with a good song.I hope everyone will try and then practice to wake up morning with a good music and also start our day with a fresh and good music.
Yes and it always give me a positive feeling for the day especially if I was singing it the day before.
Yup .. sometimes when i had an great day before and was thinking about in night about the things !! It does happen in everyone life ))
Yes, whatever music I hear most gets in my head and I keep signing it and my sister thinks it’s annoying.
Yes I have rock n roll
Yes  i like to listen a pop
Yes all the time. Mostly country music.
Music is forever playing in my head …. I just wish i was the D.J..
I always wake up with a song in my head..
